comments:
I don't think it's just me, but I when I upgraded my version of gtk2 to
2.3.0 from 2.2.x eclipse stopped working. And when I switched back
everything was fine again. Does anyone know of a workaround?

This is from a message sent on Eclipse-dev mailing list.

I've running Eclipse on GTK+-2.2.4 and never had this problem.
Anyway, as far as I understand odd versions number like 2.3 are unstable & 
untested development stream.
Check the file ftp://ftp.gtk.org/pub/gtk/v2.3/README.UNSTABLE, it says:
"This directory contains development release of Pango
and GTK+. For stable releases see the v2.2 directory."

Reopen this pr if it fails on a stable version of GTK like 2.2.4 or the future 
2.4.
*** Bug 46390 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Felipe, 
please take a look at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=46390

I reported this error (with eclipse-2.1.2 instead of 3) on the gtk-devel-list.
The answers I got point towards a possible incompatibility of the upcoming gtk
version with the way eclipse handles the toolbar or so.

Better check now, while not many people use this new gtk, instead of waiting
until gtk-2.4 gets released and thousands of people will complain about eclipse
not longer working.

It also can be a bug in the GTK 2.3 that will get fix before a main realese or 
it can something wrong with your system only...

Anyhow, I will leave this bug around. In order to verify this problem I need 
to download and compile GTK 2.3 what I don't have right now.

some new information from the gtk-devs:
http://mail.gnome.org/archives/gtk-devel-list/2003-November/msg00054.html

so let's wait and hope for the  upcoming 2.3.1
*** Bug 46776 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

According with:
http://mail.gnome.org/archives/gtk-devel-list/2003-November/msg00054.html

Someone could load the latest GTK from their CVS HEAD, compile it, and see if 
this bug is fixed ? Other options is wait fot the release of GTK 2.3.1.

Build 3.0M5

This is still not fixed with GTK 2.3.1.  It fails with the exact same exception.

Actually, my previous statement is not quite true.  It fails with a NPE in
ToolBar widget but not in releaseWidget

I've enter a bug against GTK for this problem:
http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=131245

Lets see if we get this fixed for GTK 2.4 or we'll need to fix it in SWT.
... and it will be fixed before gtk+ 2.4 is released (that's what I meant to say).

Which bug is this in bugzilla.gnome.org?  I do not see a ToolBar bug like this,
is someone on the GTK team aware that the problem must be fixed in GTK+?

The GTK bug reported:
http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=131245
is what is causing the NPE we are getting when we try to run eclipse with gtk-
2.3.x
The bug is fixed in GTK+ HEAD now.

I did just install the latest gtk release, gtk+-2.3.2 and now I can run eclipse
again.
